org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.model
Class Subscription

java.lang.Object
  org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.model.Subscription
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Subscription
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

A helper class that models subscription characteristics. An expiration date is a date in the future on which a subscription expires. That date depends on the current expiration date, if any, and the term of the subscription.

Author:
Robert J. Muller
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Subscription

public Subscription(java.sql.Timestamp currentExpirationDate,
                    Subscription.Term term)
Create a Subscription object. Current expiration date defaults to the earliest TAIR subscription date, term defaults to biennial.

Parameters:
currentExpirationDate - the current date on which the subscription expires
term - the term period of the subscription

Subscription

public Subscription(java.sql.Timestamp currentExpirationDate)
Create a Subscription object with expiration date and default term.

Parameters:
currentExpirationDate - the expiration date timestamp

Subscription

public Subscription(Subscription.Term term)
Create a Subscription object with term and default expiration date.

Parameters:
term - the term

getIndividualItemName

public java.lang.String getIndividualItemName(java.lang.String product,
                                              java.lang.Boolean autorenew,
                                              java.math.BigInteger id)
Get the PayPal individual-subscription item name string based on a product name, the autorenew flag, and a person id.

Parameters:
product - the name of the product
autorenew - the autorenew flag (true or false)
id - the person id of the individual
Returns:
the item name string

getGroupItemName

public java.lang.String getGroupItemName(java.lang.String product,
                                         java.lang.Boolean autorenew,
                                         java.math.BigInteger id,
                                         java.math.BigInteger groupNumber)
Get the PayPal group-subscription item name string based on a product name, the autorenew flag, a person id, and a group subscription number. The combination of person id and group subscription number

Parameters:
product - the name of the product
autorenew - the autorenew flag (true or false)
id - the person id of the individual
groupNumber - the number of the group subscription for the id
Returns:
the item name string

composeItem

public void composeItem(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                        java.lang.String type,
                        java.lang.String auto)
Compose the item string from the subscription type and autorenew option setting.

Parameters:
builder - the string builder in progress
type - the type of subscription
auto - the current autorenew option setting
